Replies.Reply: The air is filled with the sounds of a warm, summer night. A light comes on in a FARMHOUSE window. The door opens, a small dog and a young girl emerge.
Yeah. Now let's get Cloverfield onto the recreational vehicle and get the fuck off MacArthur's Black Mile.
Could have been worse. Know what I'm saying?
I told you, North. Do you have a map?
Just head North. We need to get as much distance as we can between us and them.
I hate it when you get the closed ones, right?
Just Paul. You know, like Madonna or Dracula.
And what's the most plausible explanation, Clive?
There's no such thing as a thin midget? Those guys are built. Have you not seen The Station Agent?
Get off me, you fucking psycho!
It's not invisibility per so. It's more like what a chameleon does with a little light blending thrown in for good measure.
You sure? How about a cup of coffee?
Come on Hulk, I'll get you a nice cuppa J.
Look Clive, I'm gonna go out on a limb and say this is probably the weirdest thing that's ever happened to you. Am i right?
And I appreciate the fact that I have somewhat gate-crashed the party here but, truth be told, I'm in a hell of a pickle. I really need your help.
Roswell was a smoke-screen man, designed to distract from the truth.
I know, fucking stupid, isn't it?
Oh you know, kickin' back, shooting the shit. Advising the government.
Restoration of damaged tissue through telepathic manipulation of cellular intrinsic field memory.
You know what? Sometimes, less is more.
Yeah I gotta take this man. It's the fucking V guys again.
Sorry, I had a warning light just like that on my ship.
Here's what I need. Some organic beef mince, organic pork, some veal, red onions, pine nuts, pecorino cheese, plum tomatoes, a fistful of fresh basil and 3 war ciabattas.

GRAHAM goes into the store, CLIVE to the pumps. A POLICE CRUISER pulls onto the forecourt. CLIVE goes pale and fumbles the nozzle back into the pump. He walks toward the checkout as a STATE TROOPER exits his car. No matter how hard he tries, CLIVE cannot avoid reaching the door at the same time as the STATE TROOPER. He is tall, wide and bald.
We're hardly the only RV on the road. Trust me, if we stay off the highways, keep to the back routes, we'll have a nice uneventful journey.
I'm not gonna eat a dead bird, am  I?
Ask me when I've finished it.
Look, I'm sorry okay? About eating the bird.
Okay, that's great. I just wondered. I'm cool with it.
I really lucked out with you nerds, didn't I?
Hey, I'm sorry. I'd love to break bread with you guys. What are we having?
Hello Clive. From the squirting of the gas and the flicking of the tongue, am I do assume you're a Hendrix fan?
Yeah. Nice man, really soft, He thought I was a hallucination.
Meanwhile Bryan Adams releases album seventeen.
I know, right? Time flies when you're confined to a U.S. military installation.
I'm the vanguard of a highly aggressive invading force.
I'm fucking with you, man. I was on a science mission actually.
Next thing I know, this little girl is pulling me out of the wreck and then a bunch of army guys come along and cart me off to Area 52.
GRAHAM joins them with the food.
So, with my cover blown and the natives cautious but friendly, I figured we might as well indulge in a little file sharing.
I'm in the can. I ate a closed mollusc.
Oh, don't give me that old irreducible complexity crap-
But it didn't just occur did it? It is the culmination of millions of years of development across countless species.
If He designed it, why didn't He just make it one part and take the whole weekend off?
Well then how do you explain me?
I didn't do anything, she fainted.
Oh come on. Who's gonna believe anything she says?
What, a delusional, one-eyed God botherer?
You know I'm sitting right here?
Look, if it makes you feel any better, my existence only disproves the notion of the Abrahamic, Judeo-
Jesus Christ, I was just trying to be nice!
Maybe. I gotta tell ya. It's at times like these you winder if the intelligent design crowd aren't onto something. I mean look at it.
11 o'clock, 12 o'clock, 11 o'clock, 12 o'clock, 11 o'clock. Come on!
Hey, we should stop for something to eat. Are you hungry, Ruth?
So, who wants to get probed first?
Tell me you got the food?
I'm feeling pretty amped up. Anyone wanna take a walk?
You gotta talk the talk, right?
Yeah yeah Snorlax, you're a real hero. Come on. Let's skedaddle. You want anything Ruth?
Hey Graham. Check this out. What d'ya think?
Steve Miller Band. I love that song. Speaking of midnight tokers, I got a littler herbal refreshment in my pants. Do you guys partake?
Shame. I get it from the military.
No, it's Paul. Like Paul Newman or the little guy from Simon and Garfunkel.
Paul Simon. Paul's not my real name. It's a name I got given.
You won't be able to pronounce it.
dealer' right? Yeah, that was mine.
The little girl who found me when I crashed. It was terrible actually.
Who knows? Never saw her again.
There's only so much knowledge I can share about the universe and quantum theory and how to make a really nice meatball sandwich. The only thing I have to offer them now are my abilities.
So the only way they're going to get hold of them is by obtaining some of somatic stem cells.
Believe me, a needle would be a picnic compared to what they had in store for me.

Bingo! Fortunately, someone was kind enough to give me the heads up, if you'll pardon the pun. So, when they were transferring me to the medical facility and I noticed the bumper sticker on your RV, I figured you might be sympathetic types. I zapped the spooks, grabbed the wheel and took my chance.
So tell me, are you guys virgins or what?
Alright then, Clive, when was the last time you got laid.
Three years ago you had sex with a midget?
There are only two types of person small enough to fit inside an Ewok costume.
I can't believe you thought boning a space bear sounded less embarrassing than a person of short stature.
Oh shit! Hey, wake up. Wake up. We fell asleep.
empathy'. You feel what I feel.
That's great! Two grown men who look like sex offenders holding hands with a child cowboy.
Suppose it does. What's your name?
I'm Paul. Pleased to meet you.
You on your own here, Keith Nash?
My friend's buying a sword. He's a grown man.
It's a good one. Take it. Go on.
Keith Nash. How much was that?
What you got there, a stigmatism?
You know you can get on operation for that, right?

Look, the way you're feeling now, that's why religion appeared in the first place. It's like existential Prozac. Imagine being five year sold and having no adults around to tell you why it snows or what trees are for. That's how it is for much of humanity. Faith is a night-
Oh. Well, then you get it, right?
Horatio. It's from Hamlet. You know, the Prince of Denmark?
Anyway, if there is a God, didn't he create doctors and hospitals and scalpels and shit, so he wouldn't have to go round fixing people's lazy eyeballs?
The eye is a delicate and complex thing, Ruth. You should get it taken care of.
That's what you're going to find out for me.
I can't just knock can I? What if she's moved on and someone else answers? I'm sick of people fainting on me. I'll hang back with my buddy Ruth, you two make first contact. Just enjoy it.
Yes. Hurry up, there's going to be a really big storm in exactly 34 minutes.
Can I do anything to help?
For killing your dog and ruining your life.
It's good to see you, Tara.
Immense pressure and temperature drop. High winds, circulating in the troposphere, two opposed fronts clashing. Oh, this is going to be a good one.
Ruth, why don't you count back from  10?
Back where I'm from, tornadoes are part of our daily life. We've learnt how to live with them, how to understand them.
We've learnt to anticipate their behavior, know their personalities, know when they're playing games.
Let me take a look at that. Ruth, shine the torch down here?
There is no way this thing isn't gonna end happy.
Looks like the geek shall inherit the earth.
Happens to the best of us.
I'm sorry I frightened you so much your hair turned white.
Take care of her big man.
Lorenzo Zoil, you're a good man.
Yeah. Three tits, awesome. Although you know what? Sometimes, less is more.
This is a self-sustaining light orb. Might come in handy, you know, if a bulb goes.
I ruined your life Tara. Think I owe you a new one.
Baby, where we're going, you won't need teeth.
Go on now Paul, don't be long.
Do you feel that the killing of Hicks and Newt in Alien 3, invalidates Ripley's struggle at the closed of the previous installment?
Yes, very unaffected. Damn, I forgot to give him my card.
I'll have a fat Coke please?
Oh man! I wanted to go to that . I wanted to find out if he actually eats the brains.
Don't be. The hard work's done, we have a great story and as usual your renderings jump from the page.
All we have to do now is sit back and enjoy.
It was like the Prancing Pony in there.
No, let's punch through. Miles make the eggs taste sweeter.
the go and jump in the Chewie seat.
They laugh heartily. Through this, GRAHAM has been taking out his laptop and setting it up on the dash board.
Absolutely. Real-time sat-nav multi map and advanced geo-tagging with continual info stream?
Thank god. I'm a wreck until I've had my first cup of J.
Amazing, isn't it? There are 295,734,134 people in this country and we haven't seen a soul for a hundred miles. Where is everybody?
Apart from her. I suppose that's why they established the Dreamland facility out here.
Did you know the site was selected in the mid-1950s for testing of the U-2 spyplane, due to its remoteness, proximity to existing facilities and presence of a dry lake bad for landings?
Do you get a lot of UFO types round here?

Did you now, it's estimated that there are as many as 200 billion galaxies in the observable universe and each of those has approximately 40 billion starts, around which orbit countless planets and moons?
I'd like a cup of coffee please.
I think I might use the loo.
Hey Graham, an alien just sicked up into my palms.
I'm joking, of course. They have a soap dispenser, shaped like an alien's head. When you pump his jaw, soap comes out of his mouth.
They were an odd pair, weren't they?
It's amazing, isn't it? We're actually here.
No, I made it up myself.
Be great if we saw something.
That would be incredible. It just sort of stops in the air and hovers then just goes up really fast.
Keep it together. First contact is a big responsibility. They come in peace, we go to pieces? That's not how I roll.
Of course it's them. We're dead.
There's only one thing for it.
I'm gonna have to fly blind.
Probably best not to do that. I couldn't really see anything.
Oh God, oh God, oh God.
We should see if they're okay.
I rather think these men need help.
I'm feeling like I've gone MENTAL MAD, Graham. If that is your name?
So forgive me if I seem a little rattled but from where I'm standing it would appear you are trading nut knowledge with an alien life form.
Oh, Paul is it? Paul what? Paul Verhoven? Paul Freeman? Paul Reiser?
How could he possibly have travelled that distance?
Balls! Graham, this isn't what it seems. What about Ocham's Razor?
Yes, the old man who owns it told me that, in unbelievable circumstances, the most plausible explanation is usually the truth.
That you're a thin midget in an alien costume.
You're not real. You're not real!
As if. We would have seen the classic shimmer and hum.
We were having a little drive.
Thank you. May I ask what you're searching for?
Well, it's pretty obvious what happened there, isn't it?

Yes, the government used some sort of neurotoxic paint on the Black Mailbox, which was white by the way, and it caused us to suffer a shared hallucination about an alien. I mean, it's what we've always wanted, isn't it?
Where the hell did you go?
Graham, there is a Grey in the galley, making me coffee.
No, what's wried, Graham, is that we have picked up an extra terrestrial hitch hiker and you seem completely fine with it!
What about the RV? It has to be back in two days.
I suppose we could phone the hire company and get an extension.
Oh my God! Roswell?! That was you?!
They invented a fake alien crash to distract from an actual alien crash?
What have you been doing here all this time?
How come you know so much?
Go on then, I'll have half.
Thank you. So, do you know where we're going?
Do you trust him, Graham? I mean, is he Strider or Black Rider?
You'd better be right. I don't want to wake up and find him inserting a probe into my anus.
There's a place called Ely five miles from here. It's small but there should be a gas station.
You know this is a gas station?
Don't you think that's a bit much?
It's find for you. You'll get whisked back to whatever lab they kept you in and we'll be arrested for harbouring a fugitive and sent to Guantanamo Bay.
Why's everything so funny? They think we're Muslims.
Paul, the authorities know we're in an TV.
Ah yes, the waspish markings of a Scott's Oriole. Unmistakable.
Don't call me Sausage in front of him.
Best case, I'd like a cold flannel on my neck and an honest meal.
Sure. Just not Sausage. Any luck with an RV park? We need somewhere off the beaten track, n'est pas?
No, thank you. I don't smoke.
Could you unwrap it for me?
What are you trying to say?
Just the way we like it.
We're just a couple of regular guys on a tour of the less touristy side of the American midwest.
Hello Ruth. Do you mind if we come in?
Doors to manual and cross check.
I'll flame up the BBQ pit. Fire's my forte.
So you've been here for 60 years?
Why did you come to earth?
I suppose we're men of science.
If we believe in anything it would be macro evolution. Cause and effect. The establishment of a biological order from the maelstrom of physical and chemical chaos.

Did you know that the universe has been dated as being 13.5 billion years old an that the release of neutral hydrogen at the moment of the big bang has enabled scientists to do this with categorical accuracy?
What did you do that for?
The authorities will be on the look out for exactly this sort of thing.
Paul, right now they're going to follow any lead they can get.
How am I going to get my passport back?
I can't drive like this. We'll have to drop her off and take our chances.
Oh great! Everyone knows the secrets of the universe apart from me. He always knew what was going on in Buffy before me because his mum had cable.
Hey, it's not fat, it's power. I happen to be very strong.
Okay, in and out, yes? Don't talk to anyone unless you have to and try to look inconspicuous.
I wish he'd stop doing that!
We'll order food and wait for you at the bar.
We're still waiting on a wet fries.
Look, I'm terribly sorry. Perhaps we can exchange insurance details?
Graham, take Ruth into the RV and lock the door. I don't want either of you to see this.
Who? Who are you talking about?
What about when I got smacked in the nose?
Is it spelt like, P-'-a-w-l-l or something?
It's strange, isn't it? Ordinarily in this situation Graham and I would be looking up at the stars, wondering about life on other planets but we know now, don't we?
I don't mean that in a bad way.
I thought the crash was our fault.
Oh, thank God. For a second there I thought I'd got drunk on Lite beer.
How are we going to get back?
Oh, come on, we've got time.
What are you going to do with this?
What shall we say if it's her?
Miss Walton, I'm the writer, Clive Gollings and this is my friend and colleague, Graham Willy. We're from England and we're here with the alien that killed your dog 60 years ago.
I think we have a problem.
Are you sure you know what you're doing?!
I only saw one car following us.
Fare thee well friend. You were a faithful and mighty steed.
He's not a goblin he's from another planet.
You are, and always will be, our friend.
Oh, say hi from us, won't you?
CLIVE nods, puts the sword down and walks away.
What are you going to ask?
I was going to ask that!
That was amazing. I was actually a bit nervous.
Hey, are you excited about going to Area 51?
Shall we try and storm the Citadel before we nod off?
It's a shame I don't have some controls on this side. That way, I could take over if you needed the loo.
And let's not forget, we've always got Analogue.
Looks like a pile of dead droids.
What about that old woman on crutches we saw hitchhiking?
Shall we have a bite before or after we hit the Black Mailbox?
Really?! You've seen more than one UFOs?
Can I have an E.T. malt please?
I was putting the sticker on.
That wasn't their truck was it?
We should be just about there.
The Groom Lake Military Test Facility.
Yes, imagine if we got buzzed up by a craft.
What would you do if they actually landed?
It's them. They found us. I don't know how but they found us.
Perhaps it's not them. Perhaps whoever it was turned doff.
I don't want my arms broken!
Maybe you should call for help.
What have you done to him?
Yes but you made him faint.
Are you going to probe us?
How come I can understand you? Are you using some sort of neural language router?
The RV's gotta be back in 2 days.
I told him he should have gone.
Paul? Where am I going again?
Hello Clive! How are you feeling?
Paul's from a small planet in the northern spiral arm of the Andromeda Galaxy.
He's right. I think that's less believable than Paul being form a planet in the norther spiral arm of the Andromeda Galaxy.
Can you do it whenever you want?
Tea's a bit weird in America, isn't it?
Clive, he's an alien. A living, breathing, alien.
Happens to the best of us.
You'd be surprised how much he's influenced popular culture generally over the last 60 years.
We had quite a long chat while you were unconscious.
I gave your jeans a swill and hung them up.
Just North. He said we had to make a right at Utah.
He said it was a surprise.
It's okay, he doesn't do that.
We need bulb for the toilet.
I hear that, Big-Rig. I can still call you Big-Rig can't I?
I sourced a website listing off the beaten track, North American RV parks.
I don't think she heard you.
We're just a couple of regular guys on tour of the less touristy side of the American midwest.
Why would Jesus want to shoot Charles Darwin?
Or it could be God. You just don't know do you?
We could take her with us.
We're only going to be a couple of days. We could let her go once Paul's gone home. I'm sure she'll be fine once she gets to know us.
Would you like a cup of tea?
I'm so sorry it had to be this way Ruth. We're definitely not going to hurt you and we'll let you go as son as we can. We were just a little concerned that you might call the police.
He's not a demon Ruth, he's from another world and we're helping him get home. He's not evil. He's just very rude.
I think what Paul's trying to say is, just because there are other inhabited planets, it's not the end of the world.
What did you do to her?!
Maybe I should make that tea?
Ruth, please stop, I've got shin splints.
Ruth, you saw for yourself. It's not just possible, it's probably.
Well, one of them is right there.
Just because your truth wasn't the truth, it doesn't mean there is no truth, Ruth.
I understand you're probably feeling very confused right now.
It isn't, it's a coincidence. Or it probably is. That's the beauty of the universe.
This is the point, Ruth. Right now.
It's okay not to know, Ruth. It's wonderful because it means we still have things to learn. We still have life to live.
So am I, but it passes, sort of.
I'm sure Ruth. I'm sure because I can honestly say, I have never talked to a woman for this long without blushing.
She's going to be fine. I think your hair looks good by the way.
Ha! Only one of us fainted!
You want to come for a walk, Ruth?
It was amazing though, wasn't it?
You can sleep in my bunk if you'd like.
I'd use a pen to push the tissues off the bed. I've had a cold.
Come on, what's your real name.
You look like a poster on a student's wall.
You never answered my question. Why Paul? Who called you Paul?
What happened to the little girl?
Paul, can I ask you something?
Why are you in such a hurry to leave?
So what, do they take a swab from your cheek?
Blood?! Oh my god, I hate needles.
Maybe we should hold hands, so that we look like a family.
Seem to be working, Clive. Clive?
Now's not really the time, Sausage.
It's very cheap. Are you sure you don't want to save up and get a proper on?
You don't think she's still there do you?
That was just awesome. Amazing driving Clive. It was like G.T.A.
He's an alien you stupid man! Oh Ruth, Ruth I'm sorry, I'm so sorry.
You can take it from there.
It really does the image justice. I never noticed the third tit.
Ladies man, huh? You guys happy?
Oh you man a FAT Coke.
Sylar's doing a Q and A in the main pavillion.
It'll pick up when he's done.
Okay, that's the hour. How'd we do?
Hey, one for each tit. Maybe you should have given her four.
Don't sweat it. It's a sleeper.
Are you nuts? My office is full of junk.
Just one item per person please.
Do you know where Sylar's on?
You boys all set? Can I get you anything else?
GRAHAM and CLIVE look at each other for a few seconds before looking back at PAT.
Nice choice. So, where have you boys come from?
Just a guess. My nephew launched a comic down there a couple of years ago. Sort of dramatized the accounts of some of the folk we've had in here.
That's it. You heard of it, huh?
A UFO? Oh, I've seen plenty.
Well, I don't know what they were.
Damn straight. Whether or not they were spaceships, I can't say.
Makes you think though, don't it?
Sure thing. How about you, sugar?
I'll take that as a yes.
Yes dear, what can I get you?
Okay then, beers for you gentleman.
Well now, I heard Utah beaver puts up quite a fight.
I better make you something good and hot. Long way to The Beehive.
We're heading into Utah. Do ourselves some hunting.
You should get that fixed up.
Holy shit! It's the space faggots that dinged the fuck-mobile!
GRAHAM and CLIVE look terribly offended.
Hey, we ain't finished with you.
Deer, coon, beaver, whatever steps in front of the bangstick, right Jake?
Why the hurry? You know I got a friend with one eye who'd love to meet you.
The Lord ain't gonna fix nothing sweetheart.
I wouldn't do that if I were you.
Don't you think this is all a bit of a coincidence?
I signed the red document this morning, Zoil. Don't you think it's odd that he chooses today to go AWOL? How did he know?
Lock down the area. Road blocks, spot checks, the whole nine yards.
So why am I not witting with my feet up, smoking a jay, watching Erin Brockovich?
Shit. My sister's kid went to that.

Like fat man doo-doo. It's too much of a coincidence. He sits tight for 60 years and then suddenly now he decides to take off. If he wanted to go home so bad, he could've just given us the slip when he was playing golf with J. Edgar Hoover.
Leave that to me. In the meantime, if E.T. is still M.I.A. in the P.M.
Zoil, what the hell's going on?
You better be right about this, Zoil. I'm getting a little tired of this shit. I want that little fucker's brain in a jar by sundown.
Satellite's come up with a data analysis on all the traffic coming out of Prospect in the last 5 hours. There was only one RV, and guess what, nimrod?
That's a three pointer Agent Zoil.
They're on the 50, heading towards Gillette.
Not much. Thunder Basis, Bethlehem Creek.
You don't think she's sill there, do you?
I don't give a shit who's in command. Where' my fucking mooncoon?!
I don't wanna hear from either of you jokers until that little mother fucker is under glass.
Zoil! What the hell is going on?
Jesus Christ, Zoil, this has been one fuck up after another. I should have handled it myself. I want that little bastard dead by midnight tonight or you'll be working security in a convention centre.
It was you! You told him. I should've known.
You've never made a mistake in your life. That's why I put you in charge of this fucking mission.
You stupid son of a bitch. In five years, you could have been where I am.
It was pretty easy once we got a fix on the geek-mobile. Wasn't hard to figure out where you were headed. You always did have a flare for the dramatic.
Be honest with yourself, two scoops. What is it that you think you can possibly bring to the table at this stage in the game?
911 Emergency. How may I direct your call? Hello? Hello?
Please hold, your call is being diverted.
I didn't do anything. He fainted.
No! Look, I need you to help. Can you get this guy back onto your wagon?
No! Where does that come from? Why do people always assume we want to stick something up their ass?

No. There's certainly nothing about it in the encounter manual. As a rule, we don't even abduct. Maybe people find it easier to deal with earthly transgressions if they suppress it with absurd fantasies about alien probing.
It's just a theory. Listen, focus okay? I promise you I won't hurt you, I just need your help.
No, I'm speaking English you prick.
Sorry, I'm tense. Look, what's your name?
Well, let's get Clive into the RV and get going. I'll explain everything on the way. Please.
Well, then we're gonna have to hustle, aren't we?
Look Graham, you're just gonna have to trust me, okay?
Three survivors, company men, hurt but alive.
What is it sir? Brake fluid? Gas?
No. It's neither of those things.
We have a guest who's left the hotel without paying, sir.
Doubtful. NORAD would have picked up a bogie. Those guys can track Santa. No sir, he's still here.
Are you suggesting he has someone on the inside.
Well he's definitely got someone on the outside.
Do you mind telling me what's going on, Agent?
I see. You fellas had much traffic through here?
Did you search the vehicle thoroughly?
Did you get the license plate?
I want everything you can remember.
I think you can be both.
We've tracked them down to a gas station in Ely.
We think he may be travelling in an RV with two British men sir.
No, sir. Just a couple of nerds on the lamb from Comic-Con.
I still think this stinks, sir.
Someone must have told him. We need to find the rat.
Given your description of the intruder, the police felt your call was perhaps better directed to us.
I understand. Do you have a photography of Ruth, Mr. Behe?
Do you have a phone Mr. Behe? In case she tries to contact you.
We'll do our best, Mr. Behe.
Can it, you two! How many times do I have to tell you?
MOSES's expression is mixture of fury and disbelief. He glances at something nearby. Pull focus to the shotgun, lying in the foreground on the kitchen table.
Agent Zoil, Secret Service. Listen very carefully. You're in great danger.
We know who you're travelling with Ruth. I need you and your friend to turn yourselves in.
Where are you? Where are you headed?
Look, I know you think you're doing the right thing but I promise you, I'm only thinking about you. And Paul. You care about Paul, don't you?
Ruth, please listen to me. Your father is worried about you. We want to get you home. I need you to tell me where you are.
You're not still talking about his balls, are you?
Good morning, Ma'am. Sorry to trouble you. Agent Zoil, Secret Service. Your wagon here matches the description of a recreational vehicle we're currently looking for. May I ask, are you alone?
Do you mind taking a look at these pictures?
Do you recognise any of these people, Miss?
Where are you coming from, Ma'am?
Where the hell do you think you're going?
And you were just gonna take off?
Well now, that's mighty civil of you. We have a chain of command. I expect you to abide by it. Where d'you say he was headed?
Oh, and Haggard? Don't go getting ideas about your station again.
They've double back sir. They're heading toward New Mexico.
It wasn't going to New Mexico?
No, sir. Where are they headed? If we gun it, maybe we can get the drop on their destination.
What the hell is he doing?!
Haggard, he knows what he's doing.
We got hit by a twister, sir.
I lost him when the ranch exploded.
He's my friend! I've known him for twenty years. He introduced me to my wife damnit!
I don't want to be where you are.
The things I do for you, huh?
Do you have any idea how difficult it was to catch you guys?
Just a big RV driven by a couple of nerds.
Yeah, they'd been to Comic-Con and met Michael Biehn.
Man, that way was one fat freak!
You did good kid. Want a candy?
We picked up a lead, sir. Little kid in the town said he saw an alien. Said he was heading toward New Mexico.
Thought it best to take the initiative, sir. We were going to radio you.
Haggard, sir. Agent Zoil has been compromised. I'm assuming command.
Just ahead of me sir. We're heading East across scrubland just North of Mitchell Creek.
